artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Akiyama Buemon; Carver: Noguchi Enkatsu
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 491 or 511?; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 134, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; six swimming fish with branches with green leaves and purple and white flowers diagonally across picture plane from URC to bottom center; fish are brown, grey, white, mustard yellow, and pink with black spots
dimension: 14 3/4 × 10 in. (37.47 × 25.4 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: 円活刀 {Enkatsu tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Printed in April and published in May.
title: Six carp swimming beneath wisteria
